job_description:
Senior Cloud Engineer
About Invoice Home Invoice Home, formerly known as Wikilane Inc. is looking for a Senior Cloud Engineer in Texas. We are a SaaS company that provides web-based business and productivity tools designed for users who want a simple and straightforward approach to the applications they use. Since Invoice Home’s humble beginnings in 2011, the app has steadily amassed over 9 million customers and consistently ranks as one of the top 5 invoicing apps in the Google Play Store and Apple App Store making it one of the lead invoicing apps on the market. Job DescriptionAs the Senior Cloud Engineer you will design and develop IT infrastructure architecture solutions to business problems in alignment with the enterprise architecture direction and standards. The Senior Cloud Engineer’s work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. We are looking for two cloud engineers to work alongside our IT team and CTO. You would work in shifts to make sure someone is on-call at all times after regular office hours (including weekends).The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience. They are a highly flexible, self-motivated individual. They enjoy learning new things and like keeping up with new technologies and developments, not only for product enhancement but also for personal and professional development.Duties and Responsibilities       Perform technical planning, architecture development and modification of specifications. Develop specifications for new IT infrastructure products and service offerings. Assess the compatibility and integration of products/services (proposed as standards).Ensure an integrated architecture across interdependent technologies.Exercise considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.Provide support of server images and multiple web server platforms. Drive Automation within the team by automating infrastructure build and configuration.Interact with peers in the department, developers and business trajectory. Provide IT architecture recommendations/guidance, troubleshooting information, etc.
 Technology Experience & Knowledge      Expert knowledge of public clouds - AWS or GCPExpert knowledge of GNU/Linux based operating systemsIn-depth knowledge of programming languages - Bash or Python.In-depth knowledge of web servers and WAF (nginx preferred).Knowledge of SQL and non SQL databases.Familiarity with DevOps and GitOps principles and tools.Knowledge of Kubernetes (preferred).Familiar with monitoring - knowledge of Zabbix (preferred).Knowledge of either automation tools - Ansible or Terraform.
Qualifications and Requirements      Remote/hybrid position must be located in Texas (in-office is OPTIONAL for this position)Willingness to travel to Austin’s office if needed. Be “on call” in case of major outages/emergencies (rotated shifts with the co-admin.) B.S. degree in Engineering (or related IT/ICT field) is required. At least 5 years of high level security experience with well trusted companies. Pass a back-ground check
Benefits      Competitive compensation based on experience and performance reviewsVacation and sick days (25 total)Company laptop, phone, and any necessary learning materialsNewly renovated and modern Space in downtown Austin.Paid parking and/or mileage reimbursement for travelParental leaveInsurance coverage up to 50% by the company 401K opportunitiesThe excitement of a startup with the stability of an established business.
Salary: 200,000 - 250,000Come join our growing team!Invoice Home is an equal opportunity employer and we greatly value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Full Stack Senior Software Engineer
Job Title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer

Location: Greater Boston, MA

 

About Us

At Synquery, we're revolutionizing the way human expert insight data is utilized. Backed by top VCs like Afore Capital and Caesar Ventures, our AI-enabled expertise platform streamlines connections between clients and experts, delivering insights with unprecedented speed, precision, and cost efficiency. We're not just another marketplace—we're crafting a platform tailored for the next generation of AI models, enabling seamless access to expertise data.

At Synquery, we value a collaborative and innovative environment, where each team member plays a vital role in shaping the future of AI-driven experiences. Our product roadmap includes AI training modules, synthetic expert personas, and an advanced suite of generative AI tools. Having recently launched our MVP, we are currently piloting it with a major customer and looking for talented, driven individuals to help take Synquery to the next level.




The Role

As a Full Stack Senior Software Engineer, you’ll work closely with our engineering and product teams to develop scalable, high-quality software solutions that drive Synquery’s mission. This is an ideal opportunity for a talented engineer to have a direct impact in a fast-paced startup, remaining hands-on with coding, problem-solving, and architecture design.

This is a high-growth position with career advancement potential, offering exposure to AI/ML and generative AI applications in a cutting-edge platform environment.

 

Responsibilities

Develop and Deliver: Design, develop, and deploy reliable, scalable, and secure features that drive Synquery’s AI-enabled expertise platform, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to meet product goals.
Code Quality: Write, review, and optimize high-quality code, maintaining best practices to ensure performance, security, and scalability.
Technical Problem Solving: Tackle complex engineering challenges with innovative solutions, contributing to architectural decisions and enhancing overall system resilience.
Continuous Improvement: Stay current with emerging technologies and methodologies, applying relevant advancements to elevate our product.
Collaboration and Communication: Work effectively with team members and stakeholders, conveying technical concepts clearly to support strategic decisions.




Qualifications

Experience: 5+ years of full stack software engineering experience in high-growth tech companies or startups.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, REST API (FastAPI), React (Next.js, Typescript), AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenSearch/Elastic, PostgreSQL
Startup Mindset: Agile, proactive, and adaptable, with the ability to navigate ambiguity and prioritize effectively.
Excellent Communication: Strong ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders clearly.
Generative AI (Desirable but not required): Exposure to NLP, LLMs (GPT, Claude, Gemini, Llama), Vector Databases (Pinecone, Milvus), and related technologies desirable.
Marketplace (Desirable but not required): Experience in building and scaling two-sided marketplaces or platform-based businesses a plus.

 

What We Offer

Significant Impact: Play a crucial role in shaping the future of Synquery and the AI industry.
Growth Opportunities: Opportunities for career advancement as we scale, with the chance to make a meaningful impact.
Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary, sizable equity options, comprehensive benefits, and flexible work arrangements.
Inclusive Culture: A supportive team environment that values diversity, innovation, and collaboration.
Professional Development: Opportunities for learning and growth, including conferences, workshops, and access to the latest technologies.

 

How to Apply

If you're passionate about leading a talented team in a mission-driven company and eager to contribute to our technical evolution, we'd love to hear from you! Please send your resume and a brief introduction. Let's shape the future of AI together.

Fullstack Engineer
NYC - ON SITE

PictureStudio (http://picture.studio) is a AI-powered suite of tools for for making extraordinary images.




JOB DESCRIPTION

We are looking to work with a talented Fullstack Engineer to help build our image creation and editing platform. Our platform includes a powerful custom prompting language that abstracts complex ML features and techniques across multiple generative backends, providing users with seamless and intuitive experiences. A large part of our system is the design, coordination, and fulfillment of these requests.

The ideal candidate will have experience with databases, queuing systems, and api design, and front end frameworks, and is excited to help grow a working prototype into a reliable and powerful product.

We are a small team of people who collaborate regularly and work hard together on interesting problems. We have a modern front-end stack built on Svelte, Typescript, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, and Python. 




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead the backend development, owning the components that orchestrate queuing, storage, and retrieval of images and prompt payloads.
Design and optimize the GraphQL schema, collaborating with the front-end team to ensure efficient data fetching.
Contribute your expertise to the database schema, ensuring robust data management.
Mentor junior team members and share your knowledge to foster continuous improvement.




SKILLS YOU’LL NEED TO BRING:

We are looking for a problem-solver who is eager to grow and learn. That said you will need to bring a workings set of skills for you to do well in this role. We are looking for 3+ years of experience in the following areas:

Working understanding of TypeScript, including modern ES fundamentals, generic types, type narrowing, etc.
Hands-on experience with GraphQL on both the client and server, including the use of dataloaders for optimized data retrieval.
Foundational understanding of relational databases and architecture.
Proven ability to design and implement scalable client-server systems, including third-party SDKs.
Expertise with cloud infrastructure, ideally Google Cloud




NICE TO HAVES:

You have experience setting up testing environments and ci/cd systems
You have familiarity and interest in the use of generative AI models such as SDXL, Flux 
You have some knowledge of constraint solvers
You have an interest in WebAssembly
You have hosted applications on cloud servers with GPUs 




HOW TO APPLY:

Please send us your resume and any of the following that apply: GitHub profile, Dribbble account, Twitter handle, blog URL, etc. (Anything that helps us learn more about what makes you tick.) Most important, send us a note telling us about what work you’re most proud of, and excited about, and what you’d like to accomplish next. More info on our jobs page: https://picture.studio/working-with-picturestudio




Be sure to include: your expected salary range, reference contacts, and your earliest possible start date.




Send everything to jobs@pictuestudio.ai
